data.title: Events around Saint
data.meta_description: A diary of major cultural, festive, gastronomic and sports events around Saint-Malo.
data.text:
Events around Saint-Malo

Events diary

Events in Saint-Malo

Literary Festival Astonishing Travellers in May.

World Folklore Festival in July.

Fireworks on July 14th.

Festival La Route du Rock in August.

Christmas Market in December.

Branlebas de Régates

From 15 to 18 august 2024

Saint-Malo et la côte d'Emeraude

Saint-Malo, Cancale via Granville A party of four days of sea between Saint-Malo and Cancale, Chausey and Granville up for the first time. Always with this double objective : provide an exception show visible from the coast and allow habitable sailboats of all kinds of "jostling". A parade on the water that brings together all generations. The old salts, happy sailboat owners are invited to take young people on board to complete their crew. The Branlebas is a feast of high definition sea but also a celebration of friendship between races and lined a single shared moment. The Regatta was born Branlebas large jousting Saint Malo the mid-nineteenth century. The fishermen then faced the sailing vessels. At that time, the public was paying to attend the Mole Noires to friendly brawl yachts of all types. It was the time of Municipal regattas contested on July 14 large festivals that marked the maritime malouine soul.

Fête des Doris - De Cale en Cale

From 31 august to 1 september 2024

Vallée de la Rance, de cale en cale

In the Vallée de la Rance The 19th Fête des doris will be held on Saturday 26th and Sunday 27th August in the Vallée de La Rance. This colorful and friendly maritime festival brings together every year a fleet of a hundred dories which sails from bilge to bilge and connects the two banks of La Rance throughout the weekend. There are also sea-yoles, old rigs, all passionate about the history of the Newfoundlanders. This event aims to gather around the Rance lovers of navigation, history and heritage. The Doris Festival is organized by the Association for the Development of the Rance Valley (ADVR), which includes 12 communes bordering La Rance, Saint-Malo and Dinard in the north, to Pleudihen-sur-Rance in the south. - Detailed program available for download -

Festival Baisers Volés

From 27 to 28 september 2024

La Découverte, La Nouvelle Vague, Rue des Acadiens

Baisers Volés is a sampling of francophone pop, a feast of discoveries and convictions, a weekend between summer and autumn, sun and night, certainties and doubts. - Designed to dance, dream, marvel, listen, smile and meet, Baisers Volés is two evenings at La Nouvelle Vague in Saint-Malo, with concerts alternating between the Club and the Grande Salle, to vary the mood without sparing a break ! - Once again this year, we'll be welcoming the artists who are making waves on the young French scene ! - Friday September 29 : ascendant vierge + Flavien Berger + Molécule + Samba de la Muerte + Nikola - Saturday September 30 : Aime Simone + Zaho de Sagazan + Voyou + Claude
